feed.title: Your Blog Name
feed.subtitle: I am writing about my experiences as a naval navel-gazer.

entry.title: weekly analysis 9/12/2022
entry.content:
• BTC price dipped close to 18,500 USD this week, as expected in the post for September 5, 2022.
  • Price is still following ealy 2019 price action.
  • Weekly Heikin Ashi candle at current price is green.
  • If candle remains green by September 19, 2022, then price could trend higher over the next weeks mirroring early 2019 price action.
  • BTC dominance might have bottomed and could incease from here.
  • Many, including me, associate an increase in BTC dominance with a decrease in the overall crypto market. However, Dave the wave likens the BTC dominance to the gold-to-silver ratio, and cautions not to correlate BTC dominance with the overall crypto price action.
  • Tweet from Dave the Wave on his views on BTC dominance:

How to square the circle... where the #btc dom ratio is practically the same at what was once the top of the market and now is the bottom of the market [potentially]. pic.twitter.com/n6HrHDyKuB

— dave the waveüåäüê´ (@davthewave) September 12, 2022

entry.title: weekly analysis - 2019 bottom compared to current price
entry.content:
• Recent price action has followed that of early 2019.
  • If this trend continues, BTC will be valued at around 35,000 USD by end of year.
  • Price could still drop to 18,500 USD before reversing upwards.
  • Difference from 2019 is that in 2022 price has gone below the 200 week moving average.
  • DXY possibly peak at around 120.
  • If DXY does reach 120, then BTC price could drop further.
  • Monthly candle closed below 50 month moving average.
  • Gray trendline could be the support, but this is speculative.
  • Price could still drop to 18,500 USD hitting the gray trendline.
